task_summary: The robot arm must identify, approach, and pick the die from the top of a black cubby shelf.

task_long_description.overview: A stationary manipulator interacts with two objects—a die and a disk—placed atop a shelf. The robot's goal is to pick up the die, which requires perception to locate the die, approaching from above, aligning precisely, computing a grasp, and executing the grasp. The sequence is robust to minor occlusions and distractions from the other object (disk). All actions occur using a parallel gripper, with pre-programmed sequences to standardize grasp approach and retreat.
preconditions: The die is present on the shelf and visible or detectable.
The gripper starts free and open.
Workspace is clear of unmodeled obstructions.
stepwise_plan: Verify die visibility or attempt detection.
Open the gripper in preparation for grasp.
Move to a predefined position above the die.
Approach and align to ensure correct pose for grasp.
Compute the top grasp pose for the die.
Execute a grasp at the pose using a top strategy.
Verify the die is in the gripper.
success_criteria: The die is securely held by the gripper at the end of the episode.
No collisions with the environment or other objects.
The die is not dropped during the sequence.
failure_and_recovery: If the die is not visible, the robot attempts detection.
If grasping fails, the episode does not include explicit retries; recovery relies on perception retry/fallback only.
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after a successful retreat with the die in gripper, or after detection/grasp failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the die is currently visible to the perception system.
Attempts to detect and localize the die using sensors (timeout 800ms).
Opens the gripper to 8cm, preparing for grasp (timeout 500ms).
Moves the gripper to a point 5cm above the die (timeout 1500ms).
Approaches and precisely aligns to the die with 0.5cm tolerance (timeout 1500ms).
Computes the grasp pose for the die from above, outputs to 'std_top'.
Performs grasp attempt at computed pose using top strategy (timeout 800ms).
Verifies that the die is currently in the gripper.
Moves the gripper 10cm away from the pick location (timeout 1200ms).

failure_modes: Die not visible due to occlusion or mislocalization.
Grasp pose not computable due to perception errors.
Grasp fails; die not held after execution.
Collision with adjacent object (disk) or shelf.
recovery_strategy: Fallback to DetectObject if IsObjectVisible fails.
No retry for failed grasp—single attempt as shown by frames.
Episode terminates after failed detection or failed grasp.
assumptions: The object being picked is visually identified as the die (cube) in the contact sheet.
No explicit Place action is required or performed in this episode; the sequence ends after the pick and retreat.
The task instruction and frames are consistent—no conflict noted.

expected_success_criteria: Die is grasped and held by the gripper at the end of the sequence.
Gripper successfully retreats from the shelf with object held.
